label: thm-rescale-function-lipschitz
subsection: 8.2.2.7 Theorem: Global Lipschitz Continuity of the Smooth Rescale Function
relations_established: Rescale function is globally Lipschitz continuous
label_text: Global Lipschitz Continuity of the Smooth Rescale Function
full_statement_text:
The **Smooth Piecewise Rescale Function** $g_A(z)$ is globally Lipschitz continuous on $\mathbb{R}$. Its Lipschitz constant, $L_{g_A}$, is the supremum of the absolute value of its first derivative, and is given by:
$$
\boxed{
L_{g_A} = \sup_{z \in \mathbb{R}} |g'_A(z)| = L_P = 1 + \frac{(3\log(2)-2)^2}{3(2\log(2)-1)} \approx 1.0054
}
$$
where $L_P$ is the uniform upper bound on the derivative of the polynomial patch from lem-cubic-patch-derivative-bounds.
